newsitem.title: USA: Smith Corona emerges from Chapter 11.
newsitem.headline: Smith Corona emerges from Chapter 11.

text.p: Smith Corona Corp. the company that introduced the portable electronic typewriter, said Friday it emerged from Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection after a 20-month reorganization.

A U.S. federal court judge approved Smith Corona's reorganization on January 27. The plan gives the company's unsecured creditors 85 percent of its common stock and about 36 cents in cash for each dollar of allowed claims.
Shareholders of record as of August 15, 1996, will receive a warrant for every 20 shares of Smith Corona stock held. The warrants can be exercised in six months and expire in two years.
Smith Corona, which traces its origins back to the development of office tyepwriters in the 1880s, introduced the portable electronic typewriter in 1957.
Today, Smith Corona designs, manufactures and distributes typewriters, personal word processors and related accessories.
It filed for Chapter 11 protection on July 5, 1995.
